sections.summary: The 'Emerging Giant' Currency. Tracks the exchange rate between the US Dollar and the Indian Rupee. It is the primary proxy for the rise of India.
sections.deep_dive: In 2026, India is the 'New Factory of the World'. As global firms 'China+1' their supply chains, USD/INR has become the most important FX pair in the Emerging Market basket. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) manages this pair with extreme precision, maintaining a 'Crawling Peg' to prevent excessive volatility that would scare off foreign investment. India's massive services exports and growing manufacturing base provide a structural demand for the Rupee, but its dependence on imported oil makes USD/INR hyper-sensitive to energy prices. For macro traders, USD/INR is the 'Stability Play'—it reflects the transformation of India into a core global industrial hub.

council_debate.macro: The 'Oil vs Services' battle. India exports software and imports oil.
council_debate.policy: The RBI is one of the world's most proactive central banks, holding $600B+ in reserves to defend the 83-85 handle.
council_debate.geopolitics: India's 'Non-Aligned' status allows it to trade with both the West and the East.
council_debate.tech: The 'India Stack': Digital public infrastructure has made the Indian economy the most digitized on earth.
council_debate.quant: Correlation with the 'Emerging Market Index' (EEM) is critical.
council_debate.technical: Watch for the breakout above 84.00; if it sustains, it signals a period of imported inflation.

sections.forecast_risks: A sudden spike in oil prices to $120, which would blow out India's current account deficit.
sections.gms_conclusion: The currency of the 21st century’s fastest-growing major economy.
